body_html: @SeveQ, yes, you are correct. For the case of host other than Windows, do you mean PCI paththrough? Would be really cool to have it on Windows. For those who would like to dig further into virtualbox direction, there is rCUDA, which does virtualization of GPUs, and is available for Windows. But then it might be easier as of now if GPU usage is absolutely necessary e.g. use ubuntu on usb drive.

body: @SeveQ, yes, you are correct. For the case of host other than Windows, do you mean [PCI paththrough](https://www.virtualbox.org/manual/ch09.html#pcipassthrough)? Would be really cool to have it on Windows. For those who would like to dig further into virtualbox direction, there is [rCUDA](http://www.rcuda.net/index.php/what-s-rcuda.html), which [does virtualization of GPUs](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/login.jsp?tp=&arnumber=6152718&url=http%3A%2F%2Fieeexplore.ieee.org%2Fxpls%2Fabs_all.jsp%3Farnumber%3D6152718), and is [available for Windows](http://www.rcuda.net/index.php/21-rcuda-for-windows.html). But then it might be easier as of now if GPU usage is absolutely necessary e.g. use ubuntu on usb drive.
